tool.name: zip
tool.summary: Sets construction variables for the &zip; archiver.

builder.name: Zip
builder.summary:
Builds a zip archive of the specified files and/or directories. Unlike most builder methods, the &b-Zip; builder method may be called multiple times for a given target; each additional call adds to the list of entries that will be built into the archive. Any source directories will be scanned for changes to any on-disk files, regardless of whether or not &scons; knows about them from other Builder or function calls.
env.Zip('src.zip', 'src')
# Create the stuff.zip file. env.Zip('stuff', ['subdir1', 'subdir2']) # Also add "another" to the stuff.tar file. env.Zip('stuff', 'another')

cvar.name: ZIP
cvar.summary: The zip compression and file packaging utility.

cvar.name: ZIPCOM
cvar.summary: The command line used to call the zip utility, or the internal Python function used to create a zip archive.

cvar.name: ZIPCOMSTR
cvar.summary:
The string displayed when archiving files using the zip utility. If this is not set, then &cv-link-ZIPCOM; (the command line or internal Python function) is displayed.
env = Environment(ZIPCOMSTR = "Zipping $TARGET")

cvar.name: ZIPCOMPRESSION
cvar.summary: The compression flag from the Python zipfile module used by the internal Python function to control whether the zip archive is compressed or not. The default value is zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED, which creates a compressed zip archive. This value has no effect when using Python 1.5.2 or if the zipfile module is otherwise unavailable.

cvar.name: ZIPFLAGS
cvar.summary: General options passed to the zip utility.

cvar.name: ZIPSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for zip file names.
